text: Sri Lanka first took part in the Olympic Games in 1948. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Sri Lanka is SRI."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 91 [PDF p. 92 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-12. In 1964, it was CEY for Ceylon. ==History== Teams took part in all Summer Olympic Games since then, but not the 1976 Games. Sri Lanka never took part in the Winter Olympic Games. The National Olympic Committee for Sri Lanka was formed in 1937 and recognized by the International Olympic Committee the same year. The nation was called Ceylon until 1972. ==List of medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event Duncan White 1948 London Athletics Men's 400 metre hurdles Susanthika Jayasinghe 2000 Sydney Athletics Women's 200 metres ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Further reading== * ==Other websites == * Sri Lanka profile at London2012.com Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Sri Lanka
